bill.title: Relating To Condominiums.
bill.description: Clarifies that if a proxy is a standard proxy form authorized by a condominium association, and the proxy is returned with no box checked or more than one box checked, the proxy shall be counted for quorum purposes only. (HB239 CD1)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Pass First Reading
Referred to IAC, CPC, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by IAC on Wednesday, 02-15-17 9:00AM in House conference room 429.

The committees on IAC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Ohno, Choy, Cachola, Ito, Onishi, Woodson, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Tokioka.
Reported from IAC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 577) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite, Tokioka excused (2).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Tuesday, 02-28-17 2:00PM in House conference room 329.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Ito, Say, Takayama, Todd, Yamane, Fukumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Ichiyama, Aquino.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1061) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-07-17.
Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Ichiyama excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 240).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPH.
The committee(s) on CPH has scheduled a public hearing on 03-14-17 9:00AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPH were as follows: 7 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Nishihara, S. Chang, Espero, Ihara, Kidani, Ruderman; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from CPH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1264) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-03-17.
Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 2 (Senator(s) Ruderman, Shimabukuro). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 404) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).

House Conferees Appointed: Ohno, Takumi Co-Chairs; Ward.

Senate Conferees Appointed: Baker Chair; Ihara, Kidani.

Conference committee meeting scheduled for 04-21-17 2:30PM in conference room 016.
Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 04-24-17 2:30PM in conference room 016.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 2 Ayes: Representative(s) Ohno, Takumi; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Ward.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Ihara, Kidani; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 21) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday 05-02-17.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 21).

Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). Ayes, 21; Aye(s) with reservations: none. Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 4 (Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Galuteria, Green, K. Kahele).
Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 737).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 642).
Transmitted to Governor.
